intro: Didymaea australis, commonly known as the southern didymaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. This perennial herb typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear minute, white to pale blue flowers. Didymaea australis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal and inland regions with low rainfall.
